amendment.description: Amendment establishes a rule of deference to State courts so that Federal judges who are entertaining habeas corpus petitions from State inmates would be required to consider whether the claimant received a full and fair adjudication of their complaint.
amendment.purpose: An amendment to establish a rule of deference to state courts so that federal judges who are entertaining habeas corpus petitions from state inmates would be required to consider whether the claimant received a full and fair adjudication of their complaint. This would effectively bar federal judges from extensively relitigating state cases.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Cox amendment (A004) Agreed to by recorded vote: 291 - 140 (Roll no. 106).
